text: {"answer":"C","reasoning":"i is incorrect: a popular initiative is invalid only if it violates mandatory international law (ius cogens), not merely the ECHR. ii is incorrect: Swiss res judicata is not broadly binding as to findings of fact/legal reasoning for later disputes; it generally binds only as to the operative part (claim) decided. iii is incorrect: Swiss contract law applies the principle of reliance (Vertrauensprinzip); even if subjective interpretations differ, a contract can exist based on objective interpretation, so not automatically dissent. iv is incorrect: the 2nd parentela is the parents and their descendants (siblings etc.), but not the parents themselves as “descendants”; the phrasing is wrong."}
